text: Gauss () was an Italian professional cycling team, which competed in elite road bicycle racing events such as the UCI Women's Road World Cup.http://www.cqranking.com/women/asp/gen/team.asp?year=2008&teamcode;=GAUhttp://www.cqranking.com/women/asp/gen/team.asp?year=2009&teamcode;=GAUhttp://www.cqranking.com/women/asp/gen/team.asp?year=2011&teamcode;=GAU For the 2012 season the team merged with MCipollini–Giambenini. ==Major wins== ;2008 :Stage 2 La Route de France Féminine, Martina Corazza :Stage 2 Tour Féminin en Limousin, Julia Martisova :Stage 4 Internationale Thüringen Rundfahrt der Frauen, Grete Treier :Stage 4b Tour de Bretagne Féminin, Tatiana Sharakova :Stage 6 Vuelta Ciclista Femenina a El Salvador, Claudia Leal Balderas ;2009 :Stage 1 Giro d'Italia Femminile, Edita Pucinskaite ;2010 :Stages 2 & 6 Giro della Toscana Int. Femminile, Giorgia Bronzini :Stage 2 Holland Ladies Tour, Martine Bras :Stage 2 Internationale Thüringen Rundfahrt der Frauen, Edita Pucinskaite :GP Cento - Carnevale d'Europa, Giorgia Bronzini :Stage 2 Ladies Tour of Qatar, Giorgia Bronzini ==National and continental champions== ;2008 :20px Russia Road Race, Julia Martisova :20px Belarus Road Race, Tatiana Sharakova :20px Estonia Road Race, Grete Treier :20px Estonia Time Trial, Grete Treier :20px Belarus Time Trial, Tatiana Sharakova :20px Italy Time Trial, Tatiana Guderzo ;2009 :20px Russia Time Trial, Tatiana Antoshina ;2010 :20px World Road Race, Giorgia Bronzini ==References== Category:Cycling teams based in Italy Category:UCI Women's Teams Category:Cycling teams established in 2008 Category:2008 establishments in Italy Category:Cycling teams disestablished in 2011 Category:2011 disestablishments in Italy
title: Gauss RDZ Ormu
